displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.successDescription: Your display name has been successfully updated.
displayName.updating: Your display name will be updated from

password.title: Password
password.description: To change your password, we will send you a secure link to your email address. Click the button below to start the password reset process.

delete.title: Delete your account
delete.description: You can delete your account if you are not the last owner of any organization. If you are the last owner, please add another owner or delete the organization and all projects first.
delete.successDescription: Your account has been successfully deleted.

dialog.title: Delete Account
dialog.blocking: You cannot delete your account because you are the last owner of the following organization(s):
dialog.instruction: Please add another owner or delete these organizations before deleting your account.
dialog.confirmPrefix: To confirm, type your email address

transfer.successDescription: The project is successfully transferred to the new organization. Redirecting...

warning.title: Warning
warning.description: Transferring the project will move it to a different organization:
warning.point1: Members who are not part of the new organization will lose access.
warning.point2: The project remains fully operational as API keys, settings, and data will remain unchanged. All features (e.g. tracing, prompt management) will continue to work without interruption.

form.description: Transfer this project to another organization where you have the ability to create projects.

delete.title: Delete Project
delete.confirmInstruction: To confirm, type "{{confirmMessage}}" in the input box

navigation.v4BetaTooltip: Toggle to use new events based v4 architecture.

feedback.description: What do you think about Langfuse? What can be improved? Please share it with the community on GitHub to shape the future of Langfuse.

annotationQueue.createDescription: Create a new queue to manage your annotation workflows.
annotationQueue.editDescription: Edit queue to manage your annotation workflows.
annotationQueue.scoreConfigsDescription: Define which dimensions annotators should score for the given queue.

table.searchPerformanceWarning: Filter table data to improve performance.

toolbar.perfWarning: For improved performance, please filter the table down.

deleteAction.cannotBeUndone: This action cannot be undone and removes all the data associated with this

success.traceDeletedDescription: Selected trace will be deleted. Traces are removed asynchronously and may continue to be visible for up to 24 hours.
success.dashboardDeletedDescription: The dashboard has been deleted successfully
success.evaluatorDeletedDescription: The running evaluator has been deleted successfully
success.defaultModelDeletedDescription: The default evaluation model has been deleted. Any running evaluations relying on the default model will be inactivated. Queued jobs will fail.

datasetActionButton.deleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. All data associated with this dataset will be permanently removed.

permissions.noAccess: You do not have access to this resource, please ask your admin to grant you access.
permissions.limitReached: You have reached the limit ({current}/{max}) for this resource at your current plan. Upgrade your plan to increase the limit.
permissions.entitlementRequired: This feature is not available in your current plan.

filters.tagsDescription: Tags let you filter traces according to custom categories (e.g. feature flags).
filters.tagsDescriptionSuffix: to learn how to add tags to your traces.
filters.sessionsDescription: Sessions group traces together, which is useful for tracing multi-step workflows.
filters.sessionsDescriptionSuffix: to learn how to add sessions to your traces.
filters.noTraceNamesFound: No trace names found in the given time range.
filters.environmentsDescription: Environments help you separate traces from different contexts (e.g. production, staging).
filters.environmentsDescriptionSuffix: on how to add environments to your traces.
filters.aiDisabled: AI features are disabled for your organization. Click to enable them in organization settings.
filters.aiAdminOnly: AI Filters: Enable in Organization Settings (Admin Only)
filters.describeFilters: Describe the filters you want to apply...
filters.aiTooltip: We convert natural language into deterministic filters which you can adjust afterwards
filters.failedToGenerate: Failed to generate filters, try again
filters.name: Name

errors.projectAccessDenied: The project you are trying to access does not exist or you do not have access to it.
errors.authErrorDefault: An authentication error occurred. Please reach out to support.
errors.contactSupportIfUnexpected: Contact support if this error is unexpected.
errors.ensureCorrectRegion: Make sure you are using the correct cloud data region.
errors.unableToCheckSso: Unable to check SSO configuration. Please try again.
errors.passwordResetNotConfigured: Password reset is not configured on this instance
errors.traceNotFoundMessage: The trace is either still being processed or has been deleted.
errors.noObservationsFound: No observations found for this trace. The trace may still be processing or has been deleted.
errors.noAccessToTrace: You do not have access to this trace.

trace.sharedDescription: This {item} is public. Anyone with the link can view this {item}.
trace.privateDescription: This {item} is private. Only authorized project members can view this {item}.

setup.title: Tracing Setup
setup.description: Setup tracing to track and analyze your LLM calls. You can create API keys and integrate Langfuse with your application.

session.notFoundMessage: The session is either still being processed or has been deleted.
session.noAccess: You do not have access to this session.

comments.title: Comments
comments.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this comment?

settings.title: Settings

hostName.title: Host Name
hostName.description: When connecting to Langfuse, use this hostname / baseurl.

projectName.title: Project Name
projectName.willBeRenamed: Your Project will be renamed from

settings.transferOwnershipDesc: Transfer this project to another organization where you have the ability to create projects.
settings.deleteProjectDesc: Once you delete a project, there is no going back. Please be certain.
settings.posthogDesc: We have teamed up with PostHog (OSS product analytics) to make Langfuse Events/Metrics available in your Posthog Dashboards.
settings.mixpanelDesc: Integrate with Mixpanel to sync your Langfuse traces, generations, and scores for advanced product analytics and insights.
settings.blobStorageDesc: Configure scheduled exports of your trace data to S3 compatible storages or Azure Blob Storage. Set up a scheduled export to your own storage for data analysis or backup purposes.
settings.slackDesc: Connect a Slack workspace and create channel automations to receive Langfuse alerts natively in Slack.

auth.signInTroubleshoot: If you are experiencing issues signing in, please force refresh this page (CMD + SHIFT + R) or clear your browser cache.
auth.oauthAccountNotLinked: Please sign in with the same provider (e.g. Google, GitHub, Azure AD, etc.) that you used to create this account.
auth.resetPasswordEmailNote: You will only receive an email if an account with this email exists and you have signed up with email and password. If you used an authentication provider like Google, Gitlab, Okta, or GitHub, please
auth.emailSent: If an account exists, you will receive an email shortly.

dashboard.feedbackDescription: Your feedback matters! Let the Langfuse team know what additional data or metrics you'd like to see in your dashboard.
dashboard.modelCostDescription: Calculated multiplying the number of tokens with cost per token for each model.

emptyState.traces: Traces contain details about LLM applications and can be created using the SDK.
emptyState.scores: Scores evaluate LLM quality and can be created manually or using the SDK.

scoresAnalytics.title: Scores Analytics
scoresAnalytics.description: Aggregate scores and averages over time
scoresAnalytics.selectScore: Select a score to view analytics

header.betaDescription: Score analytics is currently in beta. We're actively improving this feature and would love to hear your feedback.

detail.dashboardUpdatedDesc: Your changes have been saved automatically
detail.filtersSavedDesc: Dashboard filters have been saved successfully

widgets.title: Widgets
widgets.description: Manage and create widgets for your dashboard.

delete.confirmDescription: This action permanently deletes this widget. If the widget is currently used in any dashboard, you will need to remove it from those dashboards first.
delete.inUseDescription: Widget is still in use. Please remove it from all dashboards before deleting it.

configuration.title: Widget Configuration
configuration.description: Configure your widget by selecting data and visualization options

dataSelection.title: Data Selection
dataSelection.histogramAggNote: Aggregation is automatically set to histogram for histogram charts

views.tracesDescription: Traces represent a single function or request execution. They are container objects for observations and scores.
views.observationsDescription: Observations represent individual requests or operations within a trace. They are grouped into Spans, Generations, and Events.
views.scores-numericDescription: Scores are flexible objects that are used for evaluations. This view contains numeric and boolean scores.
views.scores-categoricalDescription: Scores are flexible objects that are used for evaluations. This view contains categorical scores.

pivotTable.rowDimensionsDesc: Configure up to {{max}} dimensions for pivot table rows. Each dimension creates groupings with subtotals.
pivotTable.defaultSortDesc: Configure the default sort order for the pivot table. This will be applied when the widget is first loaded.
pivotTable.sortColumnPlaceholder: Select a column to sort by

form.name: Name
form.pivotMetricRequired: At least one metric is required for pivot tables

traces.title: You don't have any traces yet
traces.description: Traces show you how your LLM calls behave in your application: what they cost, how they perform, and where things go wrong. It's the first step towards improving the behavior of your app.

sessions.title: You aren't using sessions yet
sessions.description: Sessions let you group traces that belong to the same workflow, or conversation.
sessions.guide: To start using sessions, you need to add a sessionId to your traces.

prompts.title: Get Started with Prompt Management
prompts.description: Langfuse Prompt Management helps you centrally manage, version control, and collaboratively iterate on your prompts. Start using prompt management to improve your LLM application's performance and maintainability.

decoupled.title: Decoupled from code
decoupled.description: Deploy new prompts without application redeployment, making updates faster and easier

editInUi.title: Edit in UI or programmatically
editInUi.description: Non-technical users can easily edit prompts in the UI. Developers can optionally update prompts programmatically via the API and SDKs

performance.title: Performance optimized
performance.description: Client-side caching prevents latency or availability issues for your applications

compare.title: Compare metrics
compare.description: Track latency, cost, and evaluation metrics across different prompt versions

scores.title: Get Started with Scores
scores.description: Scores allow you to evaluate the quality/safety of your LLM application through user feedback, model-based evaluations, or manual review. Scores can be used programmatically via the API and SDKs to track custom metrics.

collect.title: Collect user feedback
collect.description: Gather thumbs up/down feedback from users to identify high and low quality outputs

modelBased.title: Run model-based evaluations
modelBased.description: Use LLMs to automatically evaluate your application's outputs

track.title: Track quality metrics
track.description: Monitor quality metrics over time to identify trends and issues

custom.title: Use custom metrics
custom.description: Langfuse's scores are flexible and can be used to track any metric that's associated with an LLM application

evaluators.title: Get Started with LLM-as-a-Judge Evaluations
evaluators.description: Create evaluation templates and evaluators to automatically score your traces with LLM-as-a-judge. Set up custom evaluation criteria and let AI help you measure the quality of your outputs.

automate.title: Automate evaluations
automate.description: Use LLM-as-a-judge to automatically evaluate your traces without manual review

measure.title: Measure quality
measure.description: Create custom evaluation criteria to measure the quality of your LLM outputs

scale.title: Scale efficiently
scale.description: Evaluate thousands of traces automatically with customizable sampling rates

track.title: Track performance
track.description: Monitor evaluation metrics over time to identify trends and improvements

annotationQueues.title: Get Started with Annotation Queues
annotationQueues.description: Annotation queues help you manage manual annotation/labeling for your LLM projects. Create queues, define annotation metrics, and track progress.

manage.title: Manage scoring workflows
manage.description: Create and manage annotation queues to streamline your scoring workflows

collaborate.title: Collaborate with annotators
collaborate.description: Invite team members to annotate and evaluate your LLM outputs

track.title: Track annotation metrics
track.description: Monitor annotation progress and quality metrics across your team

baseline.title: Baseline evaluation efforts
baseline.description: Use annotation data as a baseline to evaluate your other evaluation metrics

datasets.title: Get Started with Datasets & Experiments
datasets.description: Datasets in Langfuse are collections of inputs (and expected outputs) for your LLM application. You can run Experiments against these datasets to test new releases before deployment to production.

continuous.title: Continuous improvement
continuous.description: Create datasets from production edge cases to improve your application

preDeployment.title: Pre-deployment testing
preDeployment.description: Benchmark new releases before deploying to production

structured.title: Structured testing
structured.description: Run experiments on collections of inputs and expected outputs

custom.title: Custom workflows
custom.description: Build custom workflows around your datasets via the API and SDKs, e.g. for fine-tuning, few-shotting

datasetItems.title: Add items to your dataset
datasetItems.description: Datasets are collections of specific edge cases and underrepresented patterns used to evaluate your application.

uploadCsv.title: Upload CSV
uploadCsv.description: Import dataset items from a CSV file

addViaCode.title: Add via Code
addViaCode.description: Use our Python/TS/JS SDKs or custom API

selectTraces.title: Select Traces
selectTraces.docDescription: Creating items from production data is supported on single trace level. Click to view docs for more details.

datasetItems.noAccess: You don't have access to this feature, please contact your administrator

users.title: You aren't tracking users yet
users.description: Once you add a user ID to your traces, you can correlate costs, evaluations and other LLM Application metrics to better understand how they interact with your LLM applications.
users.guide: To start tracking users, you need to add a userId to your traces.

permissions.noAccess: You do not have access to this resource.

playground.title: Playground
playground.helpDescription: A sandbox to test and iterate your prompts across multiple windows

tools.title: Tools
tools.configure: Configure tools for your model to use.

schema.title: Schema
schema.configure: Configure JSON schema for structured output.

variables.title: Variables
variables.configure: Configure variables and message placeholders for your prompts.
variables.noVariablesOrPlaceholders: No variables or message placeholders defined.
variables.instruction: Use double curly braces in your prompts to add a variable:

playground.configureModelFirst: Please configure a model in Project Settings first

noModelConfigured.title: No Model Configured
noModelConfigured.descriptionPart1: To use the playground, you need to configure a model first. Go to
noModelConfigured.descriptionPart2: to add an LLM API key and configure your models.

playground.noLlmApiKey: No LLM API key set in project.
playground.promptsFromPlaygroundDescription: Prompts from the playground can only be saved to 'chat' prompts as they include multiple system/user messages.

traces.title: Tracing
traces.helpDescription: A trace represents a single function/api invocation. Traces contain observations. See docs to learn more.

observations.title: Observations
observations.helpDescription: Observations (Traces, Spans, Events, Generations) are the smallest unit of data in Langfuse. See docs to learn more.

sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.helpDescription: A session is a collection of related traces, such as a conversation or thread. To begin, add a sessionId to the trace. See docs to learn more.

columns.tracesTooltip: The number of traces in the session.

actions.addToQueueDesc: Add selected sessions to an annotation queue.
actions.sessionsAddedToQueueDesc: Selected sessions will be added to queue "{queueName}". This may take a minute.

users.title: Users
users.helpDescription: Attribute data in Langfuse to a user by adding a userId to your traces. See docs to learn more.

columns.userIdTooltip: The unique identifier for the user that was logged in Langfuse. See docs for more details on how to set this up.
columns.firstEventTooltip: The earliest trace recorded for this user.
columns.lastEventTooltip: The latest trace recorded for this user.
columns.totalEventsTooltip: Total number of events for the user, includes traces and observations. See data model for more details.
columns.totalTokensTooltip: Total number of tokens used for the user across all generations.
columns.totalCostTooltip: Total cost for the user across all generations.

prompts.title: Prompts
prompts.helpDescription: Manage and version your prompts in Langfuse. Edit and update them via the UI and SDK. Retrieve the production version via the SDKs. Learn more in the docs.
prompts.immutableNotice: Prompts are immutable in Langfuse. To update a prompt, create a new version.

form.name: Name
form.nameDescription: Use slashes '/' in prompt names to organize them into folders.
form.configDescription: Arbitrary JSON configuration that is available on the prompt. Use this to track LLM parameters, function definitions, or any other metadata.
form.commitMessageDescription: Provide information about the changes made in this version. Helps maintain a clear history of prompt iterations.
form.commitMessagePlaceholder: Describe what changed in this version...
form.createVersionLink: Create a new version for it here.

dashboards.title: Dashboards
dashboards.helpDescription: Manage and create dashboards for your project.

create.title: Create Dashboard
create.description: Create a new dashboard for your project
create.descPlaceholder: Describe the purpose of this dashboard. Optional, but very helpful.
create.helpText: After creating the dashboard, you can add widgets to visualize your data.
create.successDescription: Your new dashboard has been created successfully

edit.title: Edit Dashboard
edit.name: Name
edit.successDescription: The dashboard has been updated successfully

datasets.title: Datasets
datasets.helpDescription: Datasets in Langfuse are a collection of inputs (and expected outputs) of an LLM application. They are used to benchmark new releases before deployment to production. See docs to learn more.

form.name: Name
form.slugDescription: Use slashes '/' in dataset names to organize them into folders.
form.inputSchemaDescription: Validate dataset item inputs against a JSON Schema. All new and existing items must conform to this schema.
form.outputSchemaDescription: Validate dataset item expected outputs against a JSON Schema. All new and existing items must conform to this schema.

scores.title: Scores
scores.helpDescription: A scores is an evaluation of a traces or observations. It can be created from user feedback, model-based evaluations, or manual review. See docs to learn more.

annotate.title: Annotate
annotate.apiEvalVisible: API and eval scores visible on left. Add manual annotations above.

analytics.noScoresDescription: Create scores by adding evaluations to your traces and observations.
analytics.selectScoreDescription: Choose one or two scores from the dropdowns above to view analytics

annotationQueues.title: Annotation Queues
annotationQueues.helpDescription: Annotation queues are used to manage scoring workflows for your LLM projects. See docs to learn more.

evaluators.title: LLM-as-a-Judge
evaluators.helpDescription: Create evaluation templates and evaluators to automatically score your traces with LLM-as-a-judge. Set up custom evaluation criteria and let AI help you measure the quality of your outputs.

defaultModel.title: Default Evaluation Model
defaultModel.setUpMessage: Set up a default model to run evaluations.
defaultModel.updateConfirmationDescription: Are you sure you want to update the default model?

apiKeys.secretKeyDescription: This key can only be viewed once. You can always create new keys in the {{scope}} settings.
apiKeys.deleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. The API key will be permanently deleted.

llmApiKeys.title: LLM Connections
llmApiKeys.description: Connect your LLM services to enable evaluations and playground features. Your provider will charge based on usage.
llmApiKeys.deleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this connection? This action cannot be undone.

form.adapterDescription: Schema that is accepted at that provider endpoint.
form.providerDescription: Key to identify the connection within Langfuse. Cannot contain colons.
form.customModelsDescription: Custom model names that are accepted at that given endpoint.
form.customModelsAzureWarning: For Azure OpenAI, use the deployment name as model name.
form.customModelsBedrockWarning: For Bedrock, use the model ID as model name.
form.extraHeadersDescription: Optional additional HTTP headers to include with requests towards LLM provider. All header values stored encrypted {{location}}.
form.baseUrlDescription: Leave blank to use the default base URL for the given LLM adapter.
form.enableDefaultModelsDescription: Default models for the selected adapter will be available in Langfuse features.

errors.providerRequired: Please add a provider name that identifies this connection.
errors.providerFormat: Provider name cannot contain colons. Use a format like 'OpenRouter_Mistral' instead.
errors.providerExists: There already exists an API key for this provider.
errors.azureBaseUrlRequired: API Base URL is required for Azure connections.
errors.bedrockCredentialsRequired: AWS credentials are required for Bedrock.
errors.customModelRequired: At least one custom model is required for this adapter.
errors.customModelRequiredWhenDefaultDisabled: At least one custom model name is required when default models are disabled.
errors.gcpKeyRequired: GCP service account JSON key is required for Vertex AI.
errors.gcpKeyOrAdcRequired: GCP service account JSON key or Application Default Credentials is required.
errors.verificationFailed: Could not verify the API key.

form.adcDescription: When enabled, authentication uses the GCP environment's default credentials instead of a service account key.
form.encryptedStored: Your API keys are stored encrypted {{location}}.
form.gcpKeyDescription: Paste your GCP service account JSON key here. The service account must have `Vertex AI User` role permissions.
form.azureBaseUrlDescription: Please add the base URL in the following format (or compatible API): https://{instanceName}.openai.azure.com/openai/deployments
form.locationGlobalDescription: Google Cloud region (e.g., global, us-central1, europe-west4). Defaults to global as required for Gemini 3 models.
form.bedrockUpdateDescription: Leave empty to keep existing credentials. To update, provide both Access Key ID and Secret Access Key.
form.bedrockCloudDescription: These should be long-lived credentials for an AWS user with `bedrock:InvokeModel` permission.
form.bedrockSelfHostedDescription: For self-hosted deployments, AWS credentials are optional. When omitted, authentication will use the AWS SDK default credential provider chain.
form.awsDefaultChainDescription: When AWS credentials are omitted, the system will automatically check for credentials in this order:
form.awsLearnMore: Learn more about AWS credential providers ->
form.adcCheckDescription: When enabled, the system will automatically check for credentials in this order:
form.adcGcloud: gcloud CLI credentials (gcloud auth application-default login)

models.title: Model Definitions
models.description: A configuration that stores pricing information for an LLM model. Model definitions specify the cost per input and output token, enabling Langfuse to automatically calculate the price of generations based on token usage.
models.modelNameDescription: Standardized model name. Generations are assigned to this model name if they match the `matchPattern` upon ingestion.
models.matchPatternDescription: Regex pattern to match `model` parameter of generations to model pricing
models.startDateDescription: Date to start pricing model. If not set, model is active unless a more recent version exists.
models.tokenizerIdDescription: Tokenizer used for this model to calculate token counts if none are ingested. Pick from list of supported tokenizers.
models.configDescription: Some tokenizers require additional configuration (e.g. openai tiktoken). See docs for details.
models.maintainerDescription: Maintainer of the model. Langfuse managed models can be cloned, user managed models can be edited and deleted. To supersede a Langfuse managed model, set the custom model name to the Langfuse model name.
models.lastUsedDescription: Start time of the latest generation using this model

testMatch.title: Test Model Match
testMatch.description: Test which model and pricing tier your ingestion data would match against. Leave empty to match the default tier.
testMatch.modelNameDesc: The model name on your generations.

upsert.createDescription: Create a new model configuration to track generation costs.
upsert.modelNameDesc: The name of the model. This will be used to reference the model in the API. You can track price changes of models by using the same name and match pattern.
upsert.matchPatternDesc: Regular expression (Postgres syntax) to match ingested generations (model attribute) to this model definition. For an exact, case-insensitive match to a model name, use the expression: (?i)^(modelname)$

pricing.pricesDescription: Set prices per usage type for this model. Usage types must exactly match the keys of the ingested usage details.
pricing.tierDescription: Define pricing rules evaluated in priority order. Tiers are checked from top to bottom until conditions match.

preview.title: Price Preview
preview.invalidInput: Invalid price entries. Please check your input format.

scoreConfigs.title: Score Configs
scoreConfigs.description: Score configs define which scores are available for annotation in your project. Please note that all score configs are immutable.
scoreConfigs.description_part1: Score configs define which scores are available for
scoreConfigs.description_part2: in your project. Please note that all score configs are immutable.
scoreConfigs.name: Name

upsert.name: Name
upsert.descriptionPlaceholder: Provide an optional description of the score config...
upsert.label: Label

batchExports.title: Exports
batchExports.description: Export large datasets in your preferred format via the export buttons across Langfuse. Exports are processed asynchronously and remain available for download for one hour. You will receive an email notification once your export is ready.

cancelDialog.title: Cancel batch export?
cancelDialog.description: Are you sure you want to cancel this batch export? This action cannot be undone.

batchActions.title: Batch Actions
batchActions.description: Track the status of bulk operations performed on tables, such as adding observations to datasets, deleting traces, and adding items to annotation queues. Actions are processed asynchronously in the background.

members.title: Organization Members

accessDenied.title: Access Denied
accessDenied.description: You do not have permission to view members of this organization.

members.projectRoleDescription: This project role will override the default role for this current project ({currentProject}).
members.name: Name

tooltips.orgRole: The org-role is the default role for this user in this organization and applies to the organization and all its projects.
tooltips.projectRole: The role for this user in this specific project. This role overrides the default project role.
tooltips.editOrgRole: The organization-level role can to be edited in the organization settings.
tooltips.projectNoneRole: User has no access to this project, unless they have an organization role that grants access.
tooltips.orgNoneRole: User has no access to this organization.
tooltips.editOrgRolePre: Cloud-level roles can be edited in

actions.leaveOrg: Are you sure you want to leave the organization?
actions.removeMember: Are you sure you want to remove this member from the organization?
actions.changeOrgRole: Are you sure that you want to change your own organization role?
actions.changeProjectRole: Are you sure that you want to change your own project role?
actions.cancelInvite: Are you sure you want to cancel this invitation?

rename.title: Organization Name
rename.willBeRenamed: Your Organization will be renamed from

aiFeatures.title: AI Features
aiFeatures.enableForOrg: Enable AI powered features for your organization
aiFeatures.description: This setting applies to all users and projects. Any data can be sent to AWS Bedrock within the Langfuse data region. Traces are sent to Langfuse Cloud in your data region. Your data will not be used for training models. Applicable HIPAA, SOC2, GDPR, and ISO 27001 compliance remains intact.
aiFeatures.moreDetails: More details in the docs here.
aiFeatures.confirmDescription: You are about to {status} AI features for your organization. When enabled, any data can be sent to AWS Bedrock in your data region for processing.
aiFeatures.areYouSure: Are you sure you want to proceed?

delete.title: Delete this organization
delete.description: Once you delete an organization, there is no going back. Please be certain.

dialog.title: Delete Organization
dialog.description: To confirm, type "{confirmMessage}" in the input box
dialog.hasProjects: You can only delete an organization if it has no projects associated with it. Please delete or transfer all projects first. Deleting projects may take a few minutes.

success.title: Organization Deleted
success.description: The organization has been successfully deleted.

projectOverview.demoDescription: We have built a Q&A chatbot that answers questions based on the Langfuse Docs. Interact with it to see traces in Langfuse.
projectOverview.createOrgDescription: Create an organization to get started. Alternatively, ask your organization admin to invite you.
projectOverview.inviteDescription: You need to get invited to an organization to get started with Langfuse.
projectOverview.organizationDescription: Organizations help you manage access to projects. Each organization can have multiple projects and team members with different roles.

auditLogs.title: Audit Logs
auditLogs.description: Track who changed what in your project and when. Monitor settings, configurations, and data changes over time. Reach out to the Langfuse team if you require more detailed/filtered audit logs.
auditLogs.enterprise: Audit logs are an Enterprise feature. Upgrade your plan to track all changes made to your project.

accessDenied.title: Access Denied
accessDenied.description: Contact your project administrator to request access.

notifications.title: Notification Settings

email.title: Email Notifications
email.description: Manage your email notification preferences for this project.

commentMentions.title: Comment Mentions
commentMentions.description: Receive an email when someone mentions you in a comment

notifications.updateError: Failed to update notification preference. Please try again.

setup.title: Tracing Setup
setup.description: Set up tracing to track and analyze your LLM calls. You can create an API Key and integrate Langfuse into your application.

tracing.getApiKeysDescription: You need to create an API Key to start tracing your application. You can create more keys later in project settings.
tracing.addTracingDescription: Langfuse relies on OpenTelemetry to instrument your application and export LLM application/agent traces to Langfuse. You can use our SDKs or one of the 50+ framework integrations. Follow the quickstart in the docs to add Langfuse to your application.
tracing.secretKeyDescription: This secret key can only be viewed once. You can always create new keys in the project settings.

setup.title: Setup

newOrganization.title: New Organization
newOrganization.description: Organizations are used to manage your projects and teams.

organizationMembers.title: Organization Members
organizationMembers.description: Invite members to your organization to collaborate on projects. You can always add more members later.

newProject.title: New Project
newProject.description: Projects are used to group traces, datasets, evals and prompts. Multiple environments are best separated via tags within a project.

setup.helpDescription: Create a new organization. This will be used to manage your projects and teams.
